hero.description: Curious Full Stack Developer with a passion for building high-performance systems, from back-end to front-end. Hands-on experience with Java, Spring Boot, Python, FastAPI, TypeScript, and Next.js.

about.title: About Me
paragraphs: Curious Full Stack Developer passionate about building high-performance systems. My experience ranges from developing robust RESTful APIs with Java (Spring Boot), C# (ASP.NET), and Python (FastAPI), to creating dynamic and responsive interfaces with TypeScript, React.js, and Next.js. I am familiar with databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite, and I use tools like Docker and CI/CD practices to optimize the development workflow.

Currently, I apply a business-integrated vision in consulting, working on marketing, people management, and business process projects. I seek to collaborate on purpose-driven projects, combining technical knowledge with management skills to deliver complete and effective solutions.

description: Active participation in strategic projects with an integrated view of operations
Structuring flows for client acquisition and monitoring
Initiatives for organizational culture and defining corporate values
Creation of marketing campaigns and audience analysis
Support in project management tasks and client relations
Assistance in the development of marketing strategies and business processes
Development of an automation solution in Python with Pandas and Selenium
Reduction of 40% in time spent on repetitive tasks

items.title: Hardware Store System
items.description: Desktop application for managing a hardware store, developed for the Software Development Lab course using Python. The project follows clean architecture principles with patterns like Repository and Service Layer, a GUI built with PyQt6, and data persistence through SQLAlchemy.

items.title: FURIA CS2 Fanbot
items.description: Full-stack solution that offers a conversational experience for FURIA fans. The project integrates a Telegram Bot (Python), a REST API optimized with caching (Fastify.js), and a responsive landing page (Next.js), all orchestrated with Docker Compose. CI/CD is managed by Vercel.

items.title: Scheduling System API
items.description: Robust RESTful API for managing appointments, developed with ASP.NET Core and Entity Framework. It implements JWT authentication, role-based access control (Admin/Client), and a complete flow for scheduling and managing time slots. The project is containerized with Docker and documented using Swagger UI.

items.title: API From Scratch (Java)
items.description: RESTful API built with plain Java (no frameworks), showcasing the fundamentals of the HTTP protocol and persistence patterns (SQLite and text files). It implements CRUD operations for user management.

items.title: Insight Web App
items.description: Web application for a personality quiz, built with React and TailwindCSS. It consumes the Profile Insight API to fetch questions and calculate results, and features an offline mode that uses internal data when the server is unavailable.

items.title: Profile Insight API
items.description: Profile analysis API that combines SWI-Prolog's declarative logic with FastAPI’s performance (Python). The system uses a knowledge base to provide questions and calculate profile diagnostics (Dominance, Influence, etc.), and is fully containerized with Docker.

items.title: JWT Login Auth API
items.description: Authentication API built with Spring Boot and Spring Security. It uses JWT for access control and an in-memory H2 database for simplicity, focusing on a secure user registration and login system.

items.title: Music Streaming API
items.description: One of my first experiences with the Spring Boot ecosystem. REST API inspired by Spotify, using Spring Security for authentication and JPA/Hibernate for persistence with MySQL. The API manages users, songs, and playlists, and includes Swagger documentation.

items.title: Pokédex Electron
items.description: Cross-platform desktop application built with Electron and TypeScript. This Pokédex app consumes data from the PokéAPI and includes a releases page with builds for Windows, macOS, and Linux, demonstrating the ability to create and distribute installable software.

contact.title: Let's Talk?
contact.subtitle: I am always open to new opportunities and interesting projects. Get in touch with me!
